title.narrative: AERC 25 Years and Beyond: Building Enduring Capacity for Economic Policy Analysis in Africa
L'AERC à 25 ans - renforcement durable des capacités d'analyse des politiques économiques en Afrique

description.narrative:
This year, the African Economic Research Consortium (AERC) marks its 25th anniversary. This project will provide funding to AERC to showcase its achievements and introduce its new management team at an event in Nairobi in fall 2013.
A consortium of donors, including IDRC, founded AERC in 1988 as a public not-for-profit organization. Its purpose: to advance economic policy research and training. AERC has achieved successes in these areas based on its strengths in networking, collaboration, and partnerships.
AERC has provided training and support to more than 3,300 African researchers from 25 countries. The training program has produced more than 2,000 master's graduates and has also supported 400 PhD students.
Building a pan-African policy network In addition to these achievements, AERC has created a high-level policy network of more than 900 senior African policymakers through its regional Senior Policy Seminars. These bring together ministers of finance, governors and deputy governors of central banks, and heads of government departments, among other senior government officials. AERC programs have also generated an extensive body of research results that is directly relevant to African economic policy.
This project will reinforce AERC's leadership in African academia and the policy-making community, along with the international community, as a responsive, forward-thinking and reputable organization and partner. It will also allow AERC to: -showcase its achievements; -increase its profile and visibility to stakeholders; -create demand for AERC products and services among stakeholders; -develop new institutional partnerships with organizations, governments, and private sector wishing to jointly undertake policy-relevant research and capacity building in policy formulation; and, -enhance the long-term sustainability of AERC's activities by attracting other non-traditional sources of funding.
